# tidypollute: Getting to Know the Package

## Goals of this Notebook

This notebook orients you to `tidypollute` functions in a functional example (pun intended).

------------------------------------------------------------------------

This request receives data from EPA AirData flat files, for **analyte** (pollutant) == `LEAD` over a given time range.

```{r, message=F, warning=F}
library(tidypollute)
```

```{r}
possible_analytes = get_epa_airdata_analyte_codes()
possible_analytes
```

```{r, message=F, warning=F, echo=T}
lead <- get_epa_airdata(analyte = "LEAD", 
                        start_year = 1999, 
                        end_year = 2000, 
                        freq = "daily")
```

```{r}

participants_df <- tibble::tibble(
  participant_id = 1:5,
  start_date = as.Date(c("2005-06-01", "2010-01-01", "2015-03-15", "2008-07-10", "2012-09-20")),
  end_date = as.Date(c("2005-12-31", "2010-12-31", "2015-09-30", "2009-05-20", "2013-06-15")),
  age = c(65, 72, 50, 60, 58),
  smoking_status = c("Never", "Former", "Current", "Never", "Former"),
  dementia = c(0,1,1,0,1)
)

```

```{r}
exposure_df = summarise_exposure(participants_df,
                               air_quality_df="",
                               date_col="",
                               pollutant_col="",
                               start_col="",
                               end_col="",
                               group_vars = NULL)
```
